persona.name: Frank & Marie Dubois
persona.description: Established Retiree Couple in Quebec with Multiple Income Sources

oasClawback.description: Partial OAS clawback due to high income

testScenarios.name: Quebec Tax System
testScenarios.description: Test Quebec's unique tax system with abatement
assertions: Federal abatement should be applied (16.5% reduction)
Quebec provincial tax rates should be higher than other provinces
Quebec basic personal amount should be higher
Quebec medical expense credit should apply

testScenarios.name: OAS Clawback Calculation
testScenarios.description: Test Old Age Security clawback for high-income seniors
assertions: OAS clawback should begin at income threshold (~$86,912)
Clawback rate should be 15% of excess income
Net OAS should be reduced by clawback amount
Clawback should not exceed total OAS benefit

testScenarios.name: Pension Income Splitting
assertions: Employer pension income should be eligible for splitting
Up to 50% can be allocated to lower-income spouse
RRIF income should be eligible for splitting
CPP and OAS not eligible for splitting

testScenarios.name: Senior Tax Credits
assertions: Age amount should be available for both spouses
Pension income amount should apply to eligible pension income
Medical expense credit threshold should be lower for seniors
Caregiver amount should apply if spouse needs care

testScenarios.name: Complex Investment Income
testScenarios.description: Test taxation of investment income in retirement
assertions: Dividend gross-up should apply to eligible dividends
Dividend tax credit should reduce tax significantly
Capital gains should be 50% taxable
Interest income should be fully taxable

testScenarios.name: Rental Income Integration
testScenarios.description: Test rental income taxation and expenses
assertions: Rental income should be fully taxable
Rental expenses should be deductible
Depreciation on rental property should be considered
Net rental income should integrate with other income

testScenarios.name: Medical Expense Credits
testScenarios.description: Test medical expense credit for seniors with high expenses
assertions: Medical expense threshold should be 3% of net income or $2,479
Expenses above threshold should qualify for 15% credit
Medical insurance premiums should qualify
Attendant care expenses should qualify

notes: Established retiree couple in Quebec with complex income sources
Tests Quebec's unique tax system including federal abatement
OAS clawback applies due to higher retirement income
Pension income splitting opportunities for tax optimization
Multiple investment income types create complex tax calculations
High medical expenses common in older age create significant credits
Charitable donations can be optimized between spouses
